intro: Eriogonum ovalifolium var. eximium, commonly known as the eximium buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. This plant plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is valued for its ecological and ornamental qualities.
